title: Clearing the Roblox Cache: Easy Methods for Windows, Mac & Mobile

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+R on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + R on your keyboard. This will pull up the Run dialog window.

steps.title: Type %Temp%\Roblox.
steps.content: Type %Temp%\Roblox . Press ↵ Enter to run the command.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+A to highlight everything.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + A to highlight everything. Since this is the Temp folder, all of the files in this folder can be deleted.

steps.title: Delete the files.
steps.content: Delete the files. You can do this by right-clicking the files and selecting Delete . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Finder.
steps.content: Open the Finder. If you play Roblox on Mac, you can find the Roblox cache in your Caches folder.

steps.title: Click Go > Go to Folder.
steps.content: Click Go > Go to Folder . The Go button is in the bar at the top of your screen.

steps.title: Type ~/Library/Caches.
steps.content: Type ~/Library/Caches . Press ⏎ Return to enter the command and go to that folder location.

steps.title: Find and open the "com.roblox.roblox" folder.
steps.content: Find and open the "com.roblox.roblox" folder. You may have to scroll to find it.

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+A.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + A . This will select everything inside the folder.

steps.title: Delete all the files.
steps.content: Delete all the files. You can do this easily by pressing the Del key on your keyboard.

steps.title: Open your Settings app.
steps.content: Open your Settings app. On Android phones, you can easily clear the Roblox app cache from your phone settings.

steps.title: Open the apps menu.
steps.content: Open the apps menu. Go to Apps , Apps and notifications , or Application Manager . The wording may vary depending on what model of Android phone you have.

steps.title: Scroll until you find Roblox.
steps.content: Scroll until you find Roblox . Tap on it to select it.

steps.title: Tap Storage > Clear cache.
steps.content: Tap Storage > Clear cache . Once the cache is clear, exit your Settings app.

steps.title: Go to Settings > General > iPhone Storage.
steps.content: Go to Settings > General > iPhone Storage . There is no way to directly clear the Roblox cache on iOS, but one workaround is to offload the app and then reinstall it.

steps.title: Tap on Roblox.
steps.content: Tap on Roblox . You may have to scroll to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Offload App.
steps.content: Tap Offload App . This will delete the app itself, but your data will be retained.

steps.title: Reinstall Roblox.
steps.content: Reinstall Roblox. Go to the App Store and search for "Roblox," then reinstall the app. All of your data will be retained, but the app's cache will be clear.
